705747f-a.title: Brooklyn: Monroe Place - Clark Street
705747f-a.text:
36-38 Monroe Place, east side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets,
showing at the right, the Mortimer Ogden residence.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REERODUCED.
705747f-a.folder: Monroe Place & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

705748f-a.title: Brooklyn: Monroe Place - Clark Street
705748f-a.text:
Monroe Place, at the S.E. corner of Clark Street, showing The Church
Of The New Jerusalem purchased in 1868, by the Brooklyn Society of The New
Church (Swedenborgian), which was organized on June 15, 1859, from the congres
gation of The Church Of Our Father, a Universalist Society, founded in October
1842, who held their first services in a hall at the corner of Fulton and Cran-
berry Streets. The society later erected a new building at the corner of
Pineapple and Fulton Streets. Iu 1848, the latter building was destroyed by
fire, and the structure in this view was erected; and named ''The Church Of
Our ather''. The congregation of this church with that of ''The Church Of
The Redeemer''- a group4dissenters- again combined in 1868 and moved to the
corner of Grand Ave., and Leffert's Place in 1883.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAE BE REPRODUCED.
705748f-a.folder: Monroe Place & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

705749f-a.title: Brooklyn: Monroe Place - Clark Street
705749f-a.text:
45 Monroe Place, west side, between Clark and Pierrepont Street s, show-
ing the Spanish Presbyterian Church.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705749f-a.folder: Monroe Place & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

705751f-a.title: Brooklyn: Monroe Place - Clark Street
705751f-a.text:
28 Monroe Place, east side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets, show-
ing the Spencer Trask house, later the Peabody home.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
